text: Jordanita paupera is a moth of the family Zygaenidae. It is known from Turkey, Transcaucasia, Jordan, northern Iran, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan and Kazachstan. In the east, it ranges up to the Amur and Korea. The length of the forewings is 12–12.8 mm for males and 9–10.5 mm for females. Adults are on wing from June to July. The larvae feed on Artemisia species. ==References== *C. M. Naumann, W. G. Tremewan: The Western Palaearctic Zygaenidae. Apollo Books, Stenstrup 1999, ==External links== *Lepiforum e. V. *Barcode of Life Data Systems (BOLD) Category:Procridinae Category:Moths described in 1887
title: Jordanita paupera
